result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik M. Madland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.
No contact of any type with victims or their property.
Complete domestic violence programs or any other treatment/programs as required by Agent.
Write a letter of apology to the victim and to be approved by probation and Atty Froelich.

10:11  15CM225 is also included as a status conf in this hearing. Defendant Erik M. Madland in court with attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI is approved by the attorneys - no changes needed.   Victim rights have been complied with.  Froelich - 2 years probation and 4 months in the PC jail  with huber for work and treatment. Court orders S/W  Probation 3 years  Cond:  Court costs - not DNA 4 months jail  with huber for work and treatment.   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.No contact  of any type with the victims or their property.  Complete domestic voilence programs or any other treatment or programs as required by agent. Write a letter of apology to the victim and to be approved  by probation agent and DA Froelich.  If defendant sucessfully completes probation expungment will be granted. Jail sentence to begin on October 17, 2016 at 7:00 PM  RElease date FEb 14, 2017  15CM225 will be set for further hearings
Spoke w/Attorney Caffee who stated we should disregard her continuance request as her client wishes to proceed.

3:40  Defendant Erik M. Madland in court with attorney James H. Krave.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.14CF186   vacate the judgment of convictions( amended information was filed on this case with only the stalking charge remaining) on the 2 misdemeanor counts that have been refiled in 15CM46  . Th guilty plea and the DPA in 14CF186 will stand on the felony Ct 1. Amended information was filed on 3-5 15  dropped the other counts in the original complaint.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form that was  filed with the court on March 3.  Court reviews with Def . Intitial appearance is  conducted by the court. The counts in this case are reviewed with the defendant. Probation 2 years is the recomendation.  Ct 1 defendant pleads guilty.  Ct 2 Defendant pleads guilty.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 & 2.  Court orders S/W Probation 2 years on each ct conc. to each other. 7 days jail as a condtion of probation stayed until May 1, 2015 at 7:00 pm. If the defendant successfully completes probation   Huber will be allowed. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.   Epungment will be granted if the defendant successfully completes the probation
Plea hearing at 03-30-2015 03:30 pm
9:40  Attorney James H. Krave in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case will be set for plea.
Amended
Hearing at 03-05-2015 09:30 am.

2:48 Defendant Erik M. Madland in court with attorney James H. Krave.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich:  2 year deferred JOC on Ct#1, guilty to Ct#2-3 2 years probation with 1 week year jail. Apply for expungement. Krave and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1; Krave stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds Def guilty and will withhold entering  JOC. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 and Ct#3; Krave stipulates to factual basis for conviction.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#2 and Ct#3. Froelich addresses sentencing: approve DJOC on Ct#1 and 2 year probation on Ct#2 and Ct#3; 1 week conditional jail time. Krave addresses sentencing and joins in the request, but requests 1 year probation and jail time be less. Court accepts deferred agreement. Signs. Court: S/W 2 years probation on Ct#2 and Ct#3; concurrent. conditions: 7 days jail stayed until no later than Friday, May 1, 2015 at 7pm; huber allowed, agent to look at and determine if Def should get any assessments for what led to these charges. court costs. eligible to appy for expungement on Ct#2 and Ct#3 upon successful completion of probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-02-2015 02:00 pm.
